description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a, later replacement). 21 long lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with use of red for headings and keywords (sometimes overlined in red). Glazed European(?) paper. Two first folios are later replacements. The last fol. is mended with the text recopied on the repair (including the left part of the colophon). Inscription "132" in Western numerals corresponding to Brill's catalog written on the right upper corner of the upper cover pastedown. Contains magical squares and talismans. Copied on 3 Jumādá al-Ākhirah 1147? ("[al-thālith] min al-sādis min a[l-sābiʻ min] al-khāmis min a[l-thānī] ʻashr min al-hijrah"; colophon, fol. 40b; partly written by a later hand). Incipit: حمدا لمن وفق من اختاره خدمته والهمه بمحض اختياره دقايق الاسرار ولطايف حكمته وصلاة ... وبعد فيقول ... احمد الدمنهوري الحنفي المالكي الشافعي الحنبلي لما تفضل ذو الجلال والاكرام على الدولة القلية Explicit: فاصبر حتى يفرغ الدخا[ن وعلامة الاجابة ان] السيبة تدور يمينا لك[ن لاته(؟) من تمام] العمل والله اعلم بال[صواب واليه] المرجع والماب
author: Damanhūrī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim.
abstract: Treatise comprising an introduction, three chapters (bāb) and a conclusion on the magical properties of the triangle.
alternative: ʻIqd al-farāʾid fīmā lil-muthallath min al-fawāʾid
عقد الفرائد فيما للمثلث من الفوائد
extent: 40 leaves : paper, ill. ; 210 x 137 (150 x 90) mm. bound to 225 x 150 mm.

title.@value: كتاب عقد الفرائد فيما للمثلث من الفوائد
Kitāb ʻIqd al-farāʾid fīmā lil-muthallath min al-fawāʾid

provenance: Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900, from the books of Amīn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ḥulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).
creator: Damanhūrī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim.
دمنهوري، احمد بن عبد المنعم
subject: Islamic magic—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Upper and lower covers and envelope flap made of brown leather over paper pasteboard, with yellow, blue and red marbled paper pasted on the leather. Light cream paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
